subject: Chemistry

figures.description: Bohr-style atom diagram with electrons on shells and nucleus labeled. Used in Question 4.
Energy profile diagram (Energy in kJ mol^-1 vs reaction coordinate) labeled A+B (reactants), C+D (products), with marked segments X, Y, Z. Used in Question 11.

questions.question: An element X has two isotopes \(^{20}_{10}X\) and \(^{22}_{10}X\) present in the ratio 1:3. The relative atomic mass of X would be
questions.explanation: Weighted average \(=\frac{1\times 20 + 3\times 22}{1+3}=\frac{86}{4}=21.5\).

questions.question: 200 cm\(^3\) of oxygen diffuse through a porous plug in 50 seconds. How long will 80 cm\(^3\) of methane \((\text{CH}_4)\) take to diffuse through the same porous plug under the same conditions?
questions.explanation: For oxygen: \(r_{O_2}=\frac{200}{50}=4\,\text{cm}^3\text{s}^{-1}\). By Graham’s law, \(\frac{r_{CH_4}}{r_{O_2}}=\sqrt{\frac{M_{O_2}}{M_{CH_4}}}=\sqrt{\frac{32}{16}}=\sqrt{2}\). So \(r_{CH_4}=4\sqrt{2}\approx 5.657\). Time \(t=\frac{80}{5.657}\approx 14.1\,\text{s}\approx 14\,\text{s}\).

questions.question: Which of the following terms indicates the number of bonds that can be formed by an atom?
questions.explanation: Valence (valency) is the combining capacity of an atom, i.e., number of bonds it can form.

questions.question: The diagram above represents an atom of
questions.explanation: The electron arrangement shown corresponds to \(2,8,2\) (three shells), which is magnesium (Z = 12).

questions.question: Which of the following gases is the most dangerous pollutant?
questions.explanation: CO binds strongly to haemoglobin forming carboxyhaemoglobin, preventing oxygen transport.

questions.question: A side effect of soft water is that it
questions.explanation: Soft water can be more corrosive and may dissolve lead from lead pipes.

questions.question: Farmlands affected by crude oil spillage can be decontaminated by

options.text: pouring water on the affected area
burning off the oil from the area

questions.explanation: Aerobic bacteria can biodegrade hydrocarbons (bioremediation).

questions.question: Which of the following functional groups will give gas bubbles when treated with a saturated solution of sodium hydrogen trioxocarbonate(IV)?
questions.explanation: Carboxylic acids react with bicarbonate to release \(\text{CO}_2\) gas: \(\mathrm{RCOOH + NaHCO_3 \rightarrow RCOONa + H_2O + CO_2\uparrow}\).

questions.question: The oxidation state of Cr in \(\text{K}_2\text{Cr}_2\text{O}_7\) is
questions.explanation: Let Cr be \(x\): \(2(+1)+2x+7(-2)=0\Rightarrow 2x=12\Rightarrow x=+6\).

questions.question: \(2\text{Na}_2\text{O}_{2(s)} + 2\text{H}_2\text{O}_{(l)} \rightarrow 4\text{NaOH}_{(s)} + \text{O}_{2(g)}\). The substance that is oxidized in the reaction above is
questions.explanation: O in peroxide is \(-1\) and becomes 0 in \(\text{O}_2\), so peroxide oxygen is oxidized.

questions.question: Z in diagram above represents
questions.explanation: Z marks the vertical energy difference between reactants (A+B) and products (C+D), i.e., \(\Delta H\) (heat of reaction).

questions.question: The nucleus of an atom contains
questions.explanation: The nucleus contains protons and neutrons.

questions.question: Which of the following does NOT happen when a zinc rod is introduced into a solution of copper(II) sulphate?

options.text: Electrons flow towards the zinc rod
The temperature of the soil changes
The blue colour of the solution gradually disappears

questions.explanation: Zn displaces Cu2+ (rod dissolves; blue colour fades). “Temperature of the soil changes” is unrelated.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is correct during the electrolysis of a caustic soda solution using platinum electrodes?

options.text: Oxygen gas is given off at the cathode
Hydrogen gas is given off at the anode
Sodium metal is deposited at the cathode

questions.explanation: At the cathode, water is reduced to \(\text{H}_2\) and \(\text{OH}^-\), increasing alkalinity near the cathode.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is INCORRECT?

options.text: Fractional distillation of crude petroleum will give the following hydrocarbon fuels in order of increasing boiling point: Butane < Petrol < Kerosene
\(\text{H}_2\text{C}=\text{CH}_2\) will serve as a monomer in the preparation of polythene
Both but-1-ene and but-1-yne will decolourize bromine readily
Calcium carbide will react with water to form any alkyne

questions.explanation: Calcium carbide forms ethyne specifically: \(\text{CaC}_2 + 2\text{H}_2\text{O} \rightarrow \text{C}_2\text{H}_2 + \text{Ca(OH)}_2\), not “any alkyne”.

questions.question: The iron(III) oxide impurity in bauxite can be removed by

options.text: dissolution in sodium hydroxide and filtration
extraction with concentrated ammonia and reprecipitation

questions.explanation: Bayer process: \(\text{Al}_2\text{O}_3\) dissolves in NaOH; \(\text{Fe}_2\text{O}_3\) remains insoluble and is filtered off.

questions.question: Aluminium is extracted commercially from its ore by

options.text: heating aluminium oxide with coke in a furnace
the electrolysis of fused aluminium oxide in cryolite
treating cryolite with sodium hydroxide solution under pressure
heating sodium aluminium silicate to a high temperature

questions.explanation: Hall–Héroult process: electrolysis of Al2O3 dissolved in molten cryolite.

questions.question: Which of the following compounds gives a yellow residue when heated and also reacts with aqueous sodium hydroxide to give a white gelatinous precipitate soluble in excess sodium hydroxide solution?
questions.explanation: A white gelatinous hydroxide soluble in excess NaOH indicates amphoteric \(\text{Al(OH)}_3\). Hence an Al3+ salt such as \(\text{Al}_2(\text{SO}_4)_3\).

questions.question: The least easily oxidized of the metals below is
questions.explanation: Cu is least reactive among the listed metals.

questions.question: Which of the following chlorides would exhibit the least ionic character?
questions.explanation: \(\text{AlCl}_3\) is most covalent (least ionic) due to high polarizing power of \(\text{Al}^{3+}\).

questions.question: Which of the following CANNOT be obtained by fractional distillation of petroleum?
questions.explanation: Fractional distillation gives hydrocarbon fractions; hydrogen is not obtained as a petroleum fraction by distillation.

questions.question: Which of the following is used as an antiknock in automobile engines?
questions.explanation: Tetraethyl lead is a classic antiknock additive.

questions.question: The Avogadro number of 24 g of magnesium is the same as that of
questions.explanation: 24 g Mg ≈ 1 mol, and 32 g O\(_2\) = 1 mol. Same number of particles (Avogadro’s number).

questions.question: In an electrolyte set-up to protect iron from corrosion, the iron is

options.text: used with a metal of lower electropositive potential

questions.explanation: Cathodic protection makes iron the cathode so it is not oxidized.

questions.question: The removal of rust from iron by treatment with tetraoxosulphate (VI) acid is based on the
questions.explanation: Rust (hydrated iron oxides/hydroxides) is neutralized/dissolved by acid (acid–base reaction).

questions.question: The substance often used for vulcanization of rubber is
questions.explanation: Sulphur forms cross-links between polymer chains in vulcanization.

questions.question: Metals of the first transition series have special properties which are different from those of groups I and II elements because they have partially filled
questions.explanation: Partially filled d-orbitals cause typical transition-metal properties.

questions.question: A particle that contains 11 protons, 12 neutrons and 10 electrons is probably a
questions.explanation: 11 protons identifies Na; 10 electrons means \(+1\) ion (Na\(^+\)), a metallic ion.

questions.question: A catalyst increases the rate of a chemical reaction by providing a path that
questions.explanation: Catalysts lower the activation energy barrier.

questions.question: A metal M displaces Zinc from \(\text{ZnCl}_2\) solution. This shows that

options.text: electrons flow from Zinc to M
M is more electropositive than Zinc
M is more electronegative than Zinc
Zinc is more electropositive than M

questions.explanation: Displacement means M is more reactive (more electropositive) than Zn.

questions.question: Calculate the quantity of electricity in coulombs required to liberate 10 g of copper from a copper compound. [Cu = 64, \(F = 96500\,\text{C mol}^{-1}\)]
The IUPAC names for the compounds \(\text{CH}_3\text{COOH}\) and \(\text{CH}_2{=}\text{CH}_2\) are respectively
questions.explanation: \(\text{CH}_3\text{COOH\,=\,ethanoic acid}\); \(\text{CH}_2{=}\text{CH}_2\,=\,ethene\).

questions.question: The boiling point of water is higher than that of methanol because

options.text: water is an oxide while methanol is an alcohol
intermolecular forces in water are stronger than those in methanol
water is an inorganic compound while methanol is organic
water is a compound while methanol is a covalent compound

questions.explanation: Water forms a more extensive hydrogen-bonded network, giving stronger intermolecular attraction.

questions.question: If an element X of atomic number \(Z\) and mass number \(y\) is irradiated by an intense concentration of neutrons, the relevant nuclear equation is
questions.explanation: Correct neutron capture is \(^{y}_{Z}X + ^{1}_{0}n \rightarrow ^{y+1}_{Z}X\) (mass number increases by 1, atomic number unchanged). This option is not among A–D as shown in the image.

questions.question: Which combination of the following statements is correct? 1. Lowering the activation energy 2. conducting the reaction in a gaseous state 3. Increasing the temperature 4. removing the products as soon as they are formed 5. Powdering the reactant if solid
questions.explanation: Rate is increased by lowering activation energy (catalyst), increasing temperature, and increasing surface area (powdering solids).

questions.question: An element with atomic number twelve is likely to be
questions.explanation: Atomic number 12 is Mg, forming Mg\(^{2+}\) (valency 2) and ionic compounds.

questions.question: Which of the following physical properties decreases across the periodic Table?
questions.explanation: Across a period, effective nuclear charge increases, so atomic radius decreases.

questions.question: If a gas occupies a container of volume 146 cm\(^3\) at 18°C and 0.971 atm, its volume in cm\(^3\) at s.t.p is
50 cm\(^3\) of carbon(II) oxide was exploded with 150 cm\(^3\) of air containing 20% oxygen by volume, which of the reactants was in excess?
questions.explanation: Oxygen available = 20% of 150 = 30 cm\(^3\) O\(_2\). Reaction \(2\text{CO}+\text{O}_2\rightarrow 2\text{CO}_2\). 50 cm\(^3\) CO needs 25 cm\(^3\) O\(_2\). Since 30 cm\(^3\) O\(_2\) is available, oxygen is in excess.

questions.question: The formula CH\(_2\)O for ethanoic acid is regarded as its
questions.explanation: Ethanoic acid is \(\text{C}_2\text{H}_4\text{O}_2\); simplest ratio is \(\text{CH}_2\text{O}\) (empirical formula).
